Class rook

chessPiece

public class rook extends chessPiece
Class for the chesspiece rook that extends from the chessPiece class

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    rook()
    A default constructor for the rook object sets the piece to a white rook in coords A,0
    rook(chess_piece_type name, chess_piece_color color, chess_piece_columns x_coord, int y_coord)
    A constructor for the rook object that sets the initial piece info like name , color, x_coord, and y_coord

    • rook

      public rook(chess_piece_type name, chess_piece_color color, chess_piece_columns x_coord, int y_coord)
      A constructor for the rook object that sets the initial piece info like name , color, x_coord, and y_coord
      Parameters:
      name - a chess piece name that is in the chess_piece_type enum
      color - a chess piece color that is in the chess_piece_color enum
      x_coord - the initial x coordinate for the piece that is in the chess_piece_columns enum
      y_coord - the initial y coordinate for the piece that is an int

    • verifyTarget

      public Boolean verifyTarget(chess_piece_columns column, int row)
      Overrides the verifyTarget method in the chessPiece class. Verification method that verifies if a piece can move to a new position according to its ruleset and if its within the bounds of the chessboard
      Overrides:
      verifyTarget in class chessPiece
      Parameters:
      column - a new column which the piece will try to move to
      row - a new row which the piece will try to move to
      Returns:
      true if the piece is able to move to the new position passed in according to its set rules, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • chessPiece
